Class
Description
AccountAlreadyExistsException
Thrown when a user tries to sign up with a username that is already taken.
AccountAlreadyLoggedInException
Thrown when a user tries to log into an account where someone is already logged into the account.
AccountNotFoundException
Thrown when a user tries to log in with an account that does not exist.
AdminRoleRequiredException
 
ArtifactCategories
Enum defining different categories for artifacts.
ArtifactCounter
 
Artifacts
Enum representing different types of artifacts with their respective categories.
AssetSerializer
A tool for serializing JSON files into .bin files in the assets folder, ready for use by the game.
ASynchronousGameState
Represents an asynchronous state in the game where actions can be performed independently by different players.
This abstract class extends GameState and provides additional functionality to track player readiness.
Card
Abstract class representing a generic card in the game.
CardDrawer
 
CardGolden
Represents a golden card in the game, which extends the functionality of a resource card.
CardGoldenSupportClass
Class used by the Json parser as a middleman for the creation of CardGolden Objects.
It extends CardResourceSupportClass and mocks all the attributes in CardGolden.
It checks that the inputs provided by the gson deserializer are valid and if so proceeds to create a CardGolden object, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException specifying what is wrong with the inputs provided.
CardGoldenTest
 
CardJsonSerializer
A utility class for serializing and deserializing Card objects and lists of Cards to and from JSON format using the Gson library.
Serialization is achieved with one method for all Card classes, de-serialization has to be done using the method for the specific dynamic type.
CardJsonSerializerDebug
Class contains static methods to serialize Card->Json and to deserialize Json->Card Objects using the gson library with built-in logic to check for errors in the json.
SERIALIZATION: It is achieved with standard gson library methods. DESERIALIZATION: By default, the gson parser does not check that the deserialized object matches class specifications because it bypasses the constructors for the class.
This implementation makes use of support classes to enforce the usage of constructors in the following way:
Gson is used to parse the input string and is deserialized into an instance of the support class. The support class contains the logic to check that the values read with gson do not break class specifications. If the check is successful, the support class creates and returns the object of the actual class using the appropriate constructors.
CardJsonSerializerDebugTest
 
CardMap
This class stores all the information related to the player's placement of cards:
-It stores the Map of placed Cards.
-It stores the available placements for the next round.
-It stores the player's current Resources and Items counters.
CardMapRecord
Represents a record containing information about a card map in a game.
CardMaps
The singleton class `CardMaps` represents the collection of card maps for all players in the game.
CardMapTest
 
CardMapView
 
CardMapZoom
 
CardPlacer
 
CardPool
Class representing all the shared cards of a specific type (specifically resource or golden).
The list stores all the visible cards for the given type, and the deck stores the covered cards.
CardPoolRecord
 
CardPools
The CardPools class represents the collection of different card pools in the game.
CardPoolTypes
Enumerates the types of card pools available in the game.
CardPoolView
The CardPoolView class is a live component that displays the cards in a specified card pool.
CardPoolZoom
 
CardRecord
Represents a record containing information about a card in a game.
CardResource
Represents a resource card in the game, which has a specific color and points.
CardResourceSupportClass
Class used by the Json parser.
CardResourceTest
 
CardsHeld
The CardsHeld class represents the collection of cards held by a player.
CardsHeldView
The CardsHeldView class is responsible for displaying the cards currently held by the player.
CardStarter
Represents a starter card in the game, which has multiple corners and central artifacts.
CardStarterChoice
 
CardStarterSupportClass
Class used by the Json parser.
CardStarterTest
 
CardView
The CardView class represents the view of a card in the game.
CardVisibility
This class is instanced before playing a card, it stores information about how a card is being played specifically if it's been placed face up or face down and the visibility of its corners when it's being placed and when it will be covered by other cards.
CardVisibilityRecord
 
Chat
The Chat class manages both public and private chat messages within a lobby.
ChatConversationView
The ChatConversationView class is responsible for displaying the chat conversation.
ChatMessageRecord
 
ChatMessageSender
 
ChatMessagesStack
The ChatMessagesStack class represents a circular buffer for storing chat messages.
ChatMessageView
The ChatMessageView class is responsible for displaying an individual chat message.
ChatNotification
The ChatNotification class is responsible for displaying a notification in the terminal when there are new chat messages available.
ChatState
Represents the chat state in the TUI, allowing users to send and view chat messages.
ClientConnector
The ClientConnector interface represents the client-side component responsible for establishing a connection with the server, listening for packets from the server, and sending packets to the server.
ClientConnectorRMI
The ClientConnectorRMI class is an implementation of the ClientConnector interface using RMI.
It is responsible for establishing a connection with the server, listening for packets from the server, and sending packets to the server.
ClientConnectorSocket
The ClientConnectorSocket class is an implementation of the ClientConnector interface using sockets.
It is responsible for establishing a connection with the server, listening for packets from the server, and sending packets to the server.
ClientController
The ClientController class manages client-side operations and interactions with the server.
ClientDisconnectedException
 
ClientHandler
The ClientHandler interface defines methods for handling client connections.
ClientHandlerRemoteInterface
The RMIClientHandlerConnection interface defines the remote methods that can be invoked on the client handler by each client for handling communication with the server.
ClientHandlerRMI
ClientHandlerRMI class represents the RMI implementation of the ClientHandler interface.
ClientHandlerSocket
ClientHandlerSocket class represents the socket implementation of the ClientHandler interface.
ClientInputHandler
 
ClientMain
The ClientMain class is the entry point for the client application.
ClientModel
The ClientModel class represents the client-side model of the application.
ClientModelConstants
Constants class for defining limits and sizes related to the client-side model.
ClientRemoteInterface
The RMIClientConnector interface defines the remote methods that can be invoked on the client side by the client handler to interact with the client.
ClientServerMessageExecutor
Interface for executing client-server messages in a game application.
ClientServerPacket
The ClientServerPacket class represents a packet sent from the client to the server.
ColorPicker
 
ComplexState
Represents a complex state that can switch between different interactive components based on user input.
Component
The abstract base class for all components in the text-based user interface.
ConnectionState
Represents the connection state where the client attempts to connect to the server.
CoordinateIndexOutOfBounds
Exception thrown when the coordinateIndex specified as parameter in the place method in the cardMap is not a valid index as it was a negative value or greater than the size of the List of available Coordinates.
Coordinates
The Coordinates class is used to store information about where played cards have been placed by the player using an X and Y coordinates system.
CoordinatesTest
 
Corner
This class stores information about individual corners of a card.
If the corner type is EMPTY or NULL then its artifact will always be NULL, conversely if the artifact is NULL then Corner will always be expected to be EMPTY or NULL.
If the artifact is not NULL then corner type will always be ARTIFACT, conversely if the corner type is ARTIFACT then the artifact is always expected to not be NULL.
CornerType and artifact are always explicitly stated.
CornerDirection
Enum representing the cardinal directions of corners on game cards.
CornerNotFoundException
 
CornerOrientation
Represents the orientation of a corner on a game card.
CornerSupportClass
 
CornerType
Enum representing the types that a corner on a game card can have.

Deck
Class wraps around an ArrayList of Cards and adds to it a shuffle method to treat the ArrayList as if it were a deck of cards.
DrawInitialCards
Represents the game state where players draw initial cards during the setup phase.
DrawState
Represents the state where players can draw cards during the game.

Game
Singleton class representing the current state of the game.
Game
This Class stores all the information about the current game, including the list of players, the current game phase, the current round etc.
GameConstants
Constants class containing game-related constants.
GameController
The GameController class serves as the controller for the game.
It handles operations related to managing game data and interactions between players.
GameControllerObserver
The GameControllerObserver interface provides a contract for observers that monitor changes in a GameController instance.
GameException
Represents a base exception class for exceptions occurring in the context of the game.

Singleton class representing the game over state, including information about the winners of the game.

GamePickObjectiveState
Represents the state of the game where the player picks a secret objective.
GameRecord
Represents a record containing information about a game.
GameRequiredException
Thrown when a client that has not yet joined a game attempts to perform an action that requires a game
GameStartingStatus
The GameStartingStatus class is responsible for displaying the current status of the game starting process in the terminal.
GameState
Abstract class representing the state of the game within the lobby.
GameState
Represents a state in the game where specific actions can be performed.
This abstract class defines methods for the various actions that can be taken during a game and provides a default implementation for some of them.
GUIMain
 
IncorrectPasswordException
Thrown when a user tries to log in with an incorrect password.
InputHandler
The InputHandler interface defines the contract for classes that handle input messages.
They act as middleware between the ClientHandler and the Controllers, they parse serverUser inputs and either further the handling of the input to inputHandlers in the lower levels or if they are the target level they will execute the requested lobbyController method.
Classes implementing this interface are responsible for processing incoming messages from clients.
InputHandlerException
Base exception class for InputHandler-related exceptions
InputHandlingException
Base exception class for input handling related exceptions.
InputValidator
 
InteractiveComponent
 
InteractiveComponentReturns
 
InteractiveState
Abstract class representing a state with interactive components.
InvalidActionForGameStateException
Exception thrown when a player attempts an action that is not valid in the current game state.
InvalidActionForPlayerStateException
Exception thrown when a player attempts an action that is not valid in their current state.
See PlayerStates for valid player states and corresponding actions.
InvalidLobbySettingsException
 
InvalidLobbySizeToStartGameException
 
InvalidRecipientException
 
LanIpFinder
This class provides a utility to find the local LAN IP address.
LayerUser
The LayerUser interface serves as a marker interface to identify classes representing users within different layers of the server architecture.
ListenerRMI
ListenerRMI class is responsible for listening to incoming RMI connection requests from clients.
ListenerSocket
ListenerSocket class is responsible for listening to incoming TCP connection requests from clients.
When a request is received, it creates a ClientHandler to further handle the client's connection.
LiveComponent
The abstract base class for all live components in the text-based user interface.
Lobby
Singleton class representing the lobby state in the client-side model.
Lobby
This class represents a lobby in the server, managing user connections, game control, and messaging within the lobby.
LobbyChooser
 
LobbyClosedException
Thrown when a user tries to join a lobby that is closed.

Constants related to lobby operations and timers.

The LobbyController class serves as the controller for the lobby.
LobbyCreator

Base exception class for all Lobby-related exceptions.

Represents the state when a player has joined a lobby.
LobbyJoiner
 
LobbyNameAlreadyTakenException
Thrown when a user tries to create a new lobby with a name that is already taken.
LobbyNotFoundException
Thrown when a user tries to join a lobby with an invalid lobby name
LobbyPreviewObserverRelay
This class acts as an observer relay for lobby preview updates, notifying all subscribed observers when a change occurs in any of the observed lobby previews.

Represents a record containing a preview of a lobby in a game.

Singleton class representing the collection of lobby previews in the client-side model.

Represents a record containing information about a lobby in a game.
LobbyRequiredException
Thrown when a client that has not yet joined a lobby attempts to perform an action that requires a lobby
LobbyRoles
Enum representing the roles that a user can have in a lobby.
LobbySelectionState
Represents the state where the player is selecting a lobby to join.
LobbyStates
Abstract class that all classes AFTER joining a lobby have to implement to allow for the "quit" and "chat" functionality.
LobbyUser
This class represents a user within a lobby.
LobbyUserAlreadyConnectedException
Thrown when a user tries to reconnect to the lobby with an account that is not registered as DISCONNECTED.
LobbyUserColors
Enum representing the colors that a user can be.
LobbyUserConnectionStates
Enum representing the possible connection states of a lobby user.
LobbyUserRecord
Represents a record containing information about a user in a lobby.

Singleton class representing the collection of lobby users in the client-side model.
LobbyUserView
The LobbyUserView class represents a component responsible for displaying detailed information about a lobby user in the terminal.
LobbyView
The LobbyView class represents a component responsible for displaying the list of users currently in the lobby in the TUI.
LogInException
Base exception class for server log-in related exceptions
LogInRequiredException
Thrown when an anonymous client attempts to perform an action that requires a logged in client
LogInSignUp
 
LoginSignUpState
Represents the state where the player logs in or signs up.
MainLoop
Represents the main loop state in the game, where players take turns to place cards and draw new cards.
This state implements the GameState interface and defines methods to handle actions during the main gameplay loop.
MalformedInputException
Exception thrown when an input value does not match the expected type.
MaxGoldenCardsDrawnException
Exception thrown when a player attempts to draw an extra golden card beyond the maximum allowed during the cards setup state.
MaxResourceCardsDrawnException
Exception thrown when a player attempts to draw an extra resource card beyond the maximum allowed during the cards setup state.
MissingParameterException
Exception thrown when one or more expected parameters are missing from the input.
MissingRequirementException
Base exception class for exceptions that arise when trying to perform an action for which a requirement is missing
MoveAttemptOnWaitStateException
Exception thrown when a player attempts a move while in a "wait" state and don't have the permission to perform this action (usually thrown in asynchronous contexts once player has completed all allowed steps).
MultipleAccessException
Base exception class for when a client tries to access multiple instances of the same server layer at the same time.
MultipleLobbiesException
Thrown when a user tries to create a new lobby or join another lobby while already being in a lobby.
MultipleLoginViolationException
Thrown when a user tries to log in or sign up to another account without logging out of the current one.
MyPlayer
Singleton class representing the current player's state and information in the client-side model.
NetworkConstants
The NetworkConstants class contains commonly used shared values by the networking side of the application.
NoSuchRecipientException
 
NotYourTurnException
Exception thrown when a player attempts to perform a move when it is not their turn.
Objective
 
ObjectiveCandidates
Singleton class representing the list of objective candidates available in the client-side model.
ObjectiveCandidatesView
The ObjectiveCandidatesView class represents a component responsible for displaying the list of objective candidates available in the TUI.

A utility class for serializing and deserializing Objective objects and lists of objectives to and from JSON format.
ObjectiveNumeric

Represents a record containing information about an objective in a game.
ObjectivesSetup
Represents the setup state where players select their secret objectives.
ObjectiveView
The ObjectiveView class represents a component responsible for displaying details of an objective record in the TUI.
Observable
The abstract class Observable represents an observable object that can be observed by observers.
Observer
The Observer interface represents an object that observes changes in Observable objects.
ObserverRelay
 
PickSecretObjective
 
PlacedCardView
The PlacedCardView class represents a component responsible for displaying the details of a card that has been placed in the game, including its artifact type and the visibility status of its corners in the TUI.
PlaceStarterCard
Represents the initial setup state in the game, where players receive their starting cards and choose their colors.
This state implements the GameState interface and handles starter card distribution and placement, initial card draws and player color selection.
PlaceState
Represents the state where players are placing their cards on the board.
Player
The Model.Player.Player Class contains all the information about the player, and it stores contextual information about the current game that relates individually to players like what cards have been placed, what cards are being held etc.
PlayerNotFoundException
 
PlayerRecord
Represents a record containing information about a player in a game.
Players
Singleton class representing the collection of players in the client-side model.
PlayerSecretInfoRecord
Represents a record containing secret information about a player in a game.
PlayerStates
Enum representing the possible states of a player during the game.
PlayerSwitcher
Abstract class for managing the order of player turns in a game.
Concrete implementations should define the logic for determining the first player and the next player in the sequence.
PlayerSwitcherNonResilient
Implementation of PlayerSwitcher that does not consider whether players are online or offline.
This player switcher simply iterates over the list of players in order.
PlayerSwitcherResilient
Implementation of PlayerSwitcher that considers the connection status of players.
This player switcher ensures that only online players are selected for turns.
RefreshManager
Singleton class responsible for managing the refresh of observed components in the client-side model.
RMIClientSocketFactory
The RMIClientSocketFactory class is responsible for creating client sockets for RMI (Remote Method Invocation) communication.
RoleRequiredException
 
ScoreBoardView
The ScoreBoardView class represents a component responsible for displaying the scoreboard in the TUI.

SecretObjective
Singleton class representing the secret objective of the player in the client-side model.
SecretObjectiveView
The SecretObjectiveView class is responsible for displaying the secret objective in the TUI.
ServerCentralManager
The central manager class responsible for initializing and managing the server components.
ServerClientMessageExecutor
 
ServerClientPacket
The ServerClientPacket interface represents packets sent from the server to the client.
It implements the Command pattern and declares the execute method that the client will run after receiving the packet to allow it to update the appropriate classes/attributes in the model/view of the client.
ServerConnectionWizard
 
ServerController
The ServerController class serves as the controller for the server-side model.
ServerException
Base exception class for server exceptions
ServerListenerRemoteInterface
The RMIServerListenerConnection interface defines the remote methods that can be invoked on the server's RMI listener by client connections.
ServerMain
The main class to start the server application.
This class initializes the server model, controller, and starts the server socket listener.
ServerModel
This class represents the model of the server, managing user accounts, authentication, and lobbies.
ServerModelLayer
The ServerModelLayer interface defines the contract for each layer of the server model.
ServerSecurity
This abstract class contains static methods used for server security procedures.
Currently, it provides functionality for password hashing.
ServerUser
This class represents a user on the server.
ServerUserInfo
This class stores the hashed password and salt information associated with a user's login, and provides a method to validate password attempts.
SharedObjectives
Singleton class representing the shared objectives in the client-side model.
SharedObjectiveView
The SharedObjectiveView class is responsible for displaying the shared objectives in the TUI.
StarterPlaceState
Represents the state where players choose the starting cards to place on the board.
SynchronousGameState
Represents a synchronous state in the game where actions are performed by players in a turn-based manner.
This abstract class extends GameState and provides functionality for managing player turns.
Table
Class storing all common resources between players in the same game: Stores the card pools, the shared objectives etc.
Can be interpreted as the "table" on top of which the game is being played.
TableRecord
Represents a record containing information about the table in a game.
TerminalColor
 
TextUI
Text-based User Interface for interacting with the game.
TurnShower
The TurnShower class is a live component that displays whose turn it is in the game.
UnavailableLobbyUserColorException
 
UserInputListener
The UserInputListener class is responsible for continuously listening to user input from the console and passing it to the ClientController for handling.
Utilities
 
ViewState
Abstract class representing the state of the client in the game.
WaitState
Represents the state where players are waiting for their turn or for the game setup to complete.
WaitTypeView
The WaitTypeView class is a live component that displays the current waiting status of the game.
WrongServerLayerException
Thrown when a client input is forwarded to the wrong server layer for handling
Zoomer
